item.title: How to Display Data Badly
item.description: In many instances, learn by doing can be a good thing, giving people the opportunity to experience things firsthand. On the other hand, there are times where it is best to avoid events that may have a negative impact. This is particularly true in the practice of statistics and the publishing of data. Instead of making these avoidable mistakes, Howard Wainer has saved us the trouble by providing twelve rules in his article, How to Display Data Badly.
